etymology.description: 楊(杨) (yáng, "a surname") is a common Chinese surname. 斌(斌) (bīn, "refined; literary") refers to a person who is cultivated or possesses literary talent. Together, 杨斌/楊斌 (Yáng Bīn) is used as a personal name.
etymology.interpretation: 杨斌/楊斌 (Yáng Bīn) is a Chinese name combining a common surname with a given name suggesting refinement and cultural sophistication.

examples.chinese: 杨斌热爱音乐(楊斌熱愛音樂)。
杨斌去了图书馆(楊斌去了圖書館)，寻找珍贵的手稿(尋找珍貴的手稿)。
examples.pinyin: Yáng Bīn qùle túshūguǎn, xúnzhǎo zhēnguì de shǒugǎo.
examples.english: Yang Bin went to the library, searching for valuable manuscripts.

examples.chinese: 昨晚杨斌与朋友共进晚餐(昨晚楊斌與朋友共進晚餐)，交流了彼此的梦想(交流了彼此的夢想)。
examples.pinyin: Zuówǎn Yáng Bīn yǔ péngyǒu gòng jìn wǎncān, jiāoliú le bǐcǐ de mèngxiǎng.
examples.english: Last night, Yang Bin dined with friends and exchanged their dreams.
